commit message:
WFMonitor: fix for NPE when config is null (i.e. when wifi is powering off)
FixerWidget: removed redundant if

Apologies: megacommit. Will try to be more atomic but project time has been sporadic

Holo. Better layouts without linearlayout used as a crutch, new fragments, bugfixes.  Things learned from other projects.
Note: ActionBarSherlock is not integrated at this point
Bugfix: typo in QuickSettingsFragment led to WIFI_OFF being WIFI_ON, zany hijinks ensue
Bugfix: Quicksettings would sometimes appear on a tablet
Moved LogFragment text state receiver/handling to activity so it can be preserved across instances as child fragments cannot retain state

Bugfix: Options Menu not firing

Redundant LogFragmentActivity removed
Added Wifi state change broadcast handling to QuickSettingsFragment

New UI for localnetworksfragment's listview when item clicked

Layout design tweaks

Cleanup, deprecation of FragmentSwitchboard, refactored for readability
Bugfix: Sporadic null ConnectFragment when instance state restored
Bugfix for bug  #37484 https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=37484#c1

Lost a branch, managed to recover changes from stash

A few highlights: support library updated, added check for wifi watchdog and support logic to fix user bug

Layout and UI code polish

More recovered staged changes from corrupted branch.

Child fragments of LocalNetworkFragment respect backstack behavior
Bugfix: Backstack not working when ConnectFragment is instantiated and ListView item is long-tapped
Spoke too soon, monkey found an NPE

Later button cancels UI tutorial nag

Further refactoring for maintainability

Bugfix: Delete log in preferences causes NPE due to refactored Activity name

Removed redundant XML for force phone UI/logging
All reference to WifiFixerActivity changed to MainActivity
Checking in wakelock changes for test build

LocalNetworksFragment removes its orphaned backstack entries onResume

Refactored to use network disconnect intent for network disconnect event

LocalNetworksFragment refactored to use AsyncTaskLoader to push scan results to ListView

Bugfix: StringUtils.getCapabilitiesString returning OPEN for WPS networks.

Bugfix: ToggleService would get stuck

Bugfix: Loader

LocalNetworksLoader uses lifecycle events to register/unregister broadcastreceiver.

Normalized all access to WifiManager through PrefUtil.getWifiManager method.  Method is now thread-safe.
Bugfix: Called doStart when already Started LoaderManager exception
Missed a few instances of direct WifiManager use
Static ViewHolder, for extra buttery goodness
Static ViewHolder, for extra buttery goodness
Refactored LogService to use java.util.Logger
Folded all notification code paths into NotifUtil as compatibility library makes redundant

Quicksettings redesign

Removed unused LogService timestamp/flush cruft
Added Samsung multi-window support.  This is about as good as it's going to get without some major resource selection workarounds.

proguard config checked in

android support library updated
LogFormatter: improved readability of logs
LocalNetworksFragment retains About/Connect fragments across orientation change/pause/resume

BroadcastHelper rewritten to prevent leaks

Backstack really should mostly work now, still testing.
ConnectFragment EditText style improvements
Bugfix: QuickSettings action item disappears from ActionBar as ViewPager scrolled or orientation changed
Bugfix: AboutFragment signal not updating
Preserve KnownNetworksFragment ActionMode across instances
Bugfix: Notification/Widget showing Wifi Off/Not Connected (trying to be more accurate about current state in general)
ActionBarSherlock integrated.  Bugs ahoy!

Checking in gradle build files and /dependencies (ugly but necessary)

(HEY JAKE I'M FOLLOWING APACHE LICENSE RESTRICTIONS, LOL!)
Using android support repository.  .gitignore fixed (build cruft removed)
Signed release configuration, proguard working
Closes #19
Closes #19
Merge branch 'holo' of github.com:Zanshinmu/Wifi-Fixer into holo
Bugfix: Ongoing Status Notification sometimes persists false connected state when screen goes on.
ActionMode in KnownNetworksFragment removes Actionbar tabs closing #20
I don't know why Android Studio keeps rebuilding this, gradle works fine from the command line but it's still a bit flaky.
removed shell script during release build task
Proguard: enabled symbol table to make stack traces more useful
Alarm was leaking
Notification state freshness bug RIP
bug in StatusMessage.fromIntent
Notification sometimes not displayed on gnex

Added -keep for BackupAgent
onDisconnected event failing to fire
Fix for leaked inputmethod

Removed duplicated methods, renamed egregious CamelCase violation

Checking in themes.xml
Found NPE case in StatusFragment
Maybe this will shut Android Studio up.
fixed import

inserted about/connect fragments now scale to screen size

sorted general problems with dimensions resource directory structure
build/revision update for public beta
Cleanup of preferences in preparation for redesign
Refactor: removed redundant final method parameters
checking in getHostup race condition fix attempt for testing
getHostUp enforces session id, races fixed.
redundant .toString()
Removed unnecessary allocation in LogFragment
make sure quotes are gone (bug in some cases)
Was able to reproduce 'alarm storm' on nexus one.  Choke of 1 min fixes, let's see if this works in the wild.
Wakeup for sleep alarm, not service-killed alarm

Stopwatch part of the HostMessage object: timing more accurate.

Additional logging added to HostUp check runnables to find weird ordering issue
Located source of multiple alarms if screen turned on and off rapidly.
Why wasn't AlarmExists properly checking intent?  Fixed.
This code should have never been there to begin with.
Closes #25
Authentication Error message could appear when it shouldn't due to sloppy comparator

WakeLock now has .lock method with timer parameter

Checking in Hostup and WFMonitor with current changes for deep sleep issue

Found a few more problems with proguard config
Removed WAKEUP, unecessary as sleep issue was network, not threading
con.setConnectTimeout added to getHttpHeaders
bad comparator could cause a false Connect Failed under some circumstances
better coverage for types of HTTP responses we might see

Platform subtlety: System.currentTimeMillis() doesn't include deep sleep.  Should use SystemClock.elapsedRealtime()

Checking in with minimal wake lock use.
Bugfix: Leaked wake lock via scan code path
Refactored to use BroadcastHelper
Fixed: alarm was unset OnLowMemory
Commented out logging lines
Added advanced preference for disabling sleep wake lock
Bugfix: Connect failed occurs due to prepareConnect() being called prematurely
Distinguish requested connection from onConnect event via string

Bugfix: Extra wake lock duration needed for repair events during sleep.

Bugfix: Status system would incorrectly display Wifi Off/Not connected on screen on
Network checks run immediately on connect
Changed build/revision for beta release

Bugfix: Notification could get GCed and cause hilarity

7-5-2013 build
Added timestamp to user-facing log.  Full date would be too big so used uptime.
That didn't need to be there.
ScanWatchDog causes more problems than it solves (you were right, Andy)

Bugfix: StackOverFlow due to looping virtual methods in onSharedPreferenceChanged
Preferences entry opens system wifi settings (better for most of the OEM builds)
Bugfix: Association could break (due to assocwatchdog runnable getting stuck in sleep)
Checking in build file changes
Bugfix: Crash when sleep policy set on API 17+

More accurate sleep policy text for API17+
New Feature: AT&T Hotspot Disable

Wake lock unnecessary when wifi disabled
New build tools/compat library.

Better API switching for Preferences

Bugfix: Wifi really, really wanted to be on.
